text: I just opened a webpage in safari and what did I saw?
But I only make the captions green, so the regular text should be black..?
I wondered.. then I thought.. Well I programmed this site in Firefox.
At first I thought it was a bad intepretation of the safari but I reviewed my code again and I saw this:
Umm.. oh well I haven't closed the h3 tag..
So the Safari interpretend my code right?
And the Firefox tolerated this typo??
Cause' in Firefox it works as it should: GREEN caption BLACK text.. Safari says: "No no!
You forgot to close the h3?
Well now everything is green, deal with it.."
My Question is: How tolerant are the major browsers?
What (typos, invalids, etc) do the browser tolerate?
